title: How to Uninstall Ubuntu Linux with OS Uninstaller

steps.title: Boot Ubuntu live from an USB or CD.
steps.content: Boot Ubuntu live from an USB or CD. When it asks, choose "Try Ubuntu"

steps.title: Open the terminal.
steps.content: Open the terminal. After you have successfully launched Ubuntu, you have to open the terminal. There are two ways to do this. One way is to press (Ctrl + Alt + T) and the other is to click on the Dash Home button (or hit the Windows logo key on your keyboard) and search for "Terminal".

steps.title: Install OS-Uninstaller.
steps.content: Install OS-Uninstaller. To do this type : sudo add-apt-repository ppa:yannubuntu/boot-repair and press enter. After this type : sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install -y os-uninstaller && os-uninstaller and press enter.

steps.title: Open OS-Uninstaller.
steps.content: Open OS-Uninstaller. Click on the dash home button and search for "OS-Uninstaller".

steps.title: Select the OS you want to uninstall.
steps.content: Select the OS you want to uninstall. In this case it is Ubuntu.
